definition: lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken

sentences.english: No other country thinks about food as just fueling up.
sentences.chinese: 沒有哪個國家會把食物僅僅看作果腹之用。

sentences.english: But they were thirsty and had only a few dates to eat.
sentences.chinese: 但他們口渴了，並且只要幾顆蜜棗果腹。

sentences.english: The Full Belly Project also has a pedal- powered sheller.
sentences.chinese: 果腹計劃還有另一臺腳踏板操作去殼機。

sentences.english: With nothing to eat, some resorted to eating bark they had ripped off support beams.
sentences.chinese: 由於沒有食物，一些人便剝支架上的樹皮果腹。

sentences.english: Think of someone who has nothing to eat.
sentences.chinese: 想想那些食不果腹的人吧。

sentences.english: With many of the poor, hunger is a constant problem.
sentences.chinese: 食不果腹是許多窮人經常存在的問題。

sentences.english: They feel fully satisfied even if they have to eat little food and wear shabby clothes .
sentences.chinese: 縱使是食不果腹，衣不蔽體，他們也心滿意足。

sentences.english: It must not be taken even if it's for the purposes of nourishment.
sentences.chinese: 即使爲了果腹，也不能引用。

definition: to feed to the full/to cram
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
to eat (of bird or animal)/to feed
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
